hanzi-su-wiki:
無

Значения

Не быть, не иметься, нет

Мнемоника

Искажено. Гибель целого леса, сорока деревьев — учетверение элемента десять 十. Остались только угли.

Варианты

无
purpleculture_pinyin:
wú
not to have; no; none; not; to lack; un-; -less
не иметь; нет; никто; нет; не хватает; ООН-; -меньше
rtega_mnemonic:
無無RS
无无		negative, no, not; lack, have no
  • RS. dancer holding both tails in his hands → 無 → 无: his tails or not touching the ground; fire 灬 under a bale of straw: nothing is left after it is burned
purpleculture_examples:
無法 [ wú fǎ ]: unable; incapable
無論 [ wú lùn ]: no matter what or how; regardless of whether...
無疑 [ wú yí ]: no doubt; undoubtedly
無數 [ wú shù ]: countless; numberless; innumerable
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿱ Above to below
    • 灬 [ huǒ ] fire
heisig_chinese_memo: When I enter the wooden tub heated by flames in the onsen, I can let all my worries slip away and be submerged into nothingness.
heisig_constituent: nothingness, reclining, lying down, tub, oven-fire, barbecue
heisig_story: This character is the Japanese character for the supreme philosophical principle of much Oriental thought: nothingness. Make use of the oaken tub from the previous frame, and add to that the oven fire at the bottom.
Keyword_KANJIDIC: nothingness, none, ain't, nothing, nil, not
Keyword_KANJIDIC_ru: ничто, никто, не не, ничего, ноль, не
koohiiStory1: When I enter the wooden tub heated by flames in the onsen, I can let all my worries slip away and be submerged into nothingness.
koohiiStory2: In a hot tub you can relax and have your stress vanish into nothingness.

WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: The nothing radical and the nothing kanji are exactly the same! Woah!
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: Nothing can moo (む) quite like a cow can moo. Cows are the best at going moo. That’s a fact.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Listen to this cow moo. Can you do a better moo than this moo cow? Nope.
Ru_Meaning: nothingness, none, ain't, nothing, nil, not
Ru_Radicals: 一 (один), ｜, ノ, 杰, 無 (без)
Ru_trainchinese: wú: (глаг/нареч) не иметь, нет; вне зависимости от, как бы ни; не
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: One Frankenpooch is better than nothing.
humanum_full_description_en:
Elaboration: The oracle bone inscriptions danced lightly with ornaments such as oxtails. The literature records that ancient people danced with oxtails in their hands. Midsummer Period. "Ancient Music": "The music of the Xigetian family, three people mixed with oxtails are enough to sing eight songs." Since " nothing " was later borrowed to indicate presence or absence, " nothing ", so the ornament of the inscription on the elephant oxtail was distorted into " some ". The inscription " some " can also be used as a negative word, so " some " is not only the sound symbol of " no ", but also the meaning symbol.

Oracle has not yet seen the pretense of being or not. The Bronze Age began to use the word " nothing " under the guise of being or not . Therefore, the form of two feet ("舛") was added under " nothing " to indicate " dance " (Ji Xusheng). "Wen said," Xiao Zhuan is in " non plus '' at death " to indicate " no ." This glyph is currently seen only in Hanbei.

The oracle bone inscriptions are used as the name of the sacrifice, which is the sacrifice of dancing for rain. "Collection" 30030: "No (dance), heavy rain". "Compilation" 34295: "No (dancing) river and mountain." It means to dance to the gods of rivers and mountains to pray for rain.

The inscription said no, the sagefu kept the tripod: "There is no strong in ten thousand years (Jiangsu)", Wang Sun's survivor Zhong: "There is no end in ten thousand years (period)", there is no end and time limit for ten thousand years, which is similar to the meaning of "Longevity without borders." In addition, Jia Jinwen often uses " death " as " nothing ", see " death ".

The Bamboo Slips of the Warring States Period means dancing, "Sleeping Tiger Land Qin Slips. Japanese Book A Type" Jian 76: "Ge Wu (Dance)". Also borrowed " Wu " as " None ", "Sleeping Tiger Land Qin Bamboo Slips. Japanese Book A Type, Jian 26 Rec. 3: "There is no disaster." It means that there is no disaster.

"Said Wen": "𣠮, death. From death, silent. No, odd characters are nothing, which is connected to the Yuan. Wang Yu said: "The northwest of the sky is nothing.""
humanum_short_description_en: The shape of an oracle bone inscription dancing with ornaments such as oxtails. " Nothing " is the original text of " dance ", the original meaning is dance, dance, and then " nothing " under the guise of being or not . See " dance ".
humanum_full_description:
甲骨文象人手持牛尾一類飾物翩然起舞，文獻記載古人手執牛尾跳舞，《呂氏春秋．仲夏紀．古樂》：「昔葛天氏之樂，三人摻牛尾投足以歌八闋。」由於「無」後來借來表示有無的「無」，所以金文象牛尾的飾物變形音化為「某」，金文「某」也可用作否定詞，故「某」既是「無」的聲符，又是意符。

　　甲骨文尚未見假借為有無義，金文時代開始假借為有無的「無」，故於「無」下加雙腳形(「舛」)以表示「舞」(季旭昇)。《說文》小篆則於「無」下加「亡」以表示「無」，這種字形目前只見於漢碑。

　　甲骨文用作祭名，是跳舞求雨之祭。《合集》30030：「無(舞)，大雨」。《合集》34295：「無(舞)河眔岳。」表示對河神、山神跳舞求雨。

　　金文表示沒有，善夫克鼎：「萬年無彊(疆)」，王孫遺者鐘：「萬年無諆(期)」，萬年沒有止境、期限，與「萬壽無疆」意思相近。此外，甲金文多假借「亡」為「無」，參見「亡」。

　　戰國竹簡表示跳舞，《睡虎地秦簡．日書甲種》簡76背：「歌無(舞)」。又借「毋」為「無」，《睡虎地秦簡．日書甲種》簡26背3：「則毋(無)央(殃)矣」，表示沒有禍殃。

　　《說文》：「𣠮，亡也。从亡，無聲。无，奇字无，通於元者。王育說：『天屈西北為无。』」
humanum_short_description: 甲骨文象人持牛尾一類飾物翩翩起舞之形。「無」是「舞」的初文，本義是跳舞、舞蹈，後假借為有無的「無」。參見「舞」。

甲骨文象人手持牛尾一類飾物翩然起舞，文獻記載古人手執牛尾跳舞，《呂氏春秋．仲夏紀．古樂》：「昔葛天氏之樂，三人摻牛尾投足以歌八闋。」由於「 無 」後來借來表示有無的「 無 」，所以金文象牛尾的飾物變形音化為「 某 」，金文「 某 」也可用作否定詞，故「 某 」既是「 無 」的聲符，又是意符。 甲骨文尚未見假借為有無義，金文時代開始假借為有無的「 無 」，故於「 無 」下加雙腳形(「 舛 」)以表示「 舞 」(季旭昇)。《說文》小篆則於「 無 」下加「 亡 」以表示「 無 」，這種字形目前只見於漢碑。 甲骨文用作祭名，是跳舞求雨之祭。《合集》30030：「無(舞)，大雨」。《合集》34295：「無(舞)河眔岳。」表示對河神、山神跳舞求雨。 金文表示沒有，善夫克鼎：「萬年無彊(疆)」，王孫遺者鐘：「萬年無諆(期)」，萬年沒有止境、期限，與「萬壽無疆」意思相近。此外，甲金文多假借「 亡 」為「 無 」，參見「 亡 」。 戰國竹簡表示跳舞，《睡虎地秦簡．日書甲種》簡76背：「歌無(舞)」。又借「 毋 」為「 無 」，《睡虎地秦簡．日書甲種》簡26背3：「則毋(無)央(殃)矣」，表示沒有禍殃。 《說文》：「𣠮，亡也。从亡，無聲。无，奇字无，通於元者。王育說：『天屈西北為无。』」
Elaboration: The oracle bone inscriptions danced lightly with ornaments such as oxtails. The literature records that ancient people danced with oxtails in their hands. Midsummer Period. "Ancient Music": "The music of the Xigetian family, three people mixed with oxtails are enough to sing eight songs." Since " nothing" was later borrowed to indicate presence or absence, " nothing", so the ornament of the inscription on the elephant oxtail was distorted into " some". The inscription " some" can also be used as a negative word, so " some" is not only the sound symbol of " no", but also the meaning symbol. Oracle has not yet seen the pretense of being or not. The Bronze Age began to use the word " nothing" under the guise of being or not. Therefore, the form of two feet (" 舛") was added under " nothing" to indicate " dance" (Ji Xusheng). "Wen said," Xiao Zhuan is in " non plus '' at death" to indicate " no." This glyph is currently seen only in Hanbei. The oracle bone inscriptions are used as the name of the sacrifice, which is the sacrifice of dancing for rain. "Collection" 30030: "No (dance), heavy rain". "Compilation" 34295: "No (dancing) river and mountain." It means to dance to the gods of rivers and mountains to pray for rain. The inscription said no, the sagefu kept the tripod: "There is no strong in ten thousand years (Jiangsu)", Wang Sun's survivor Zhong: "There is no end in ten thousand years (period)", there is no end and time limit for ten thousand years, which is similar to the meaning of "Longevity without borders." In addition, Jia Jinwen often uses " death" as " nothing", see " death". The Bamboo Slips of the Warring States Period means dancing, "Sleeping Tiger Land Qin Slips. Japanese Book A Type" Jian 76: "Ge Wu (Dance)". Also borrowed " Wu" as " None", "Sleeping Tiger Land Qin Bamboo Slips. Japanese Book A Type, Jian 26 Rec. 3: "There is no disaster." It means that there is no disaster. "Said Wen": "𣠮, death. From death, silent. No, odd characters are nothing, which is connected to the Yuan. Wang Yu said: "The northwest of the sky is nothing.""

無字的基本解释

無
wú
见“无”。

無字的汉语字典释义

[①]［wú］
［《廣韻》武夫切，平虞，微。］
“兦2”的今字。“无3”的繁体字。
(1)没有。
(2)哲学概念。指虚无、空虚等。
(3)非，不是。
(4)死的婉辞。
(5)微小。
(6)连词。不论。
(7)连词，即使。
(8)副词。表示否定，相当于“不”。
(9)副词。表示否定，相当于“未曾”、“没”。
(10)副词，表示反问，相当于“得无”。
(11)副词。表示禁止，相当于“不可”、“不要”。
(12)副词。用于句末，表示疑问，相当于“否”。
(13)助词。用于句首，无义。
(14)通“幠”。覆盖的布。
(15)通“鄦”。古国名。后以为姓氏，假“許”为之。周宣王时有无专。
[②]［mó］
亦作“无2”。“无4”的繁体字。
见“南2無”

無字的康熙字典解释

【巳集中】【火字部】　無； 康熙笔画：12； 页码：页673第26
〔古文〕???【唐韻】武扶切【廣韻】武夫切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】微夫切，?音巫。【說文】亡也。【玉篇】不有也。【書·舜典】剛而無虐，?而無傲。又【益稷】懋遷有無化居。　又【爾雅·釋詁】虛無之閒也。【註】虛無皆有閒隙。【老子·道德經】萬物生于有，有生于無。【周子·太極圖說】無極而太極。　又【禮·三年問】無易之道也。【註】無，猶不也。　又縣名。【前漢·地理志】越巂郡會無縣。　又姓。【正字通】漢無且明，無能。　又【廣韻】漢複姓無庸無鉤，俱出自楚。　又文無，藥名。【古今注】相別贈之以文無。文無，一名當歸。　又【說文奇字】作无。【玉篇】虛无也。周易無字俱作无。　又【集韻】或作亡。【詩·衞風】何有何亡。　又通作毋。書，無逸。【史記·魯世家】作毋逸。　又通作毛。【後漢·馮衍傳】飢者毛食。【註】衍集：毛作無。今俗語猶然。或古亦通乎。【佩觿集】河朔謂無曰毛。【通雅】江楚廣東呼無曰毛。　又【集韻】或作武。◎按禮器：詔侑武方。註：武當爲無，聲之誤也。鄭註：明言其誤。

暂无。

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［wú］
["Guangyun" Wu Fuqie, Pingyu, Wei. ]
The present word for "兦2". "No 3" in traditional characters.
(1) No.
(2) Philosophical concept. Refers to nothingness, emptiness, etc.
(3) No, no.
(4) The euphemism of death.
(5) Tiny.
(6) Conjunctions. whether.
(7) Conjunctions, even.
(8) Adverbs. Represents negative, which is equivalent to "no".
(9) Adverbs. Means negative, which is equivalent to "never" and "none".
(10) Adverb, which means rhetorical question, which is equivalent to "de nothing".
(11) Adverbs. It means prohibition, which is equivalent to "no" or "don't".
(12) Adverbs. Used at the end of a sentence to express doubt, equivalent to "no".
(13) Particles. Used at the beginning of a sentence, meaningless.
(14) Through "幠". Covered cloth.
(15) Through "Fan". Ancient country name. Later, I thought it was my last name, but assumed it as "Xu". Is there any specialization in Zhou Xuan's time.
[②]［mó］
Also called "No 2". "无4" in traditional characters.
